title: Gallery Conversation: How Were Roman Women Represented in Portraits?
hero_caption: Portrait Head of a Woman, 117-30. Roman. Edward E. Ayer Endowment in memory of Charles L. Hutchinson.
short_description: Join us for a conversation with Katharine A. Raff, Elizabeth McIlvaine Associate Curator of the Arts of the Ancient Mediterranean and Byzantium, as she shares stories and insights about the enigmatic ancient Roman sculpture, Portrait Head of a Woman.
list_description: Join us for a conversation with Katharine A. Raff, Elizabeth McIlvaine Associate Curator of the Arts of the Ancient Mediterranean and Byzantium, as she shares stories and insights about the enigmatic ancient Roman sculpture, Portrait Head of a Woman.
description: Join a conversation in the galleries with Katharine A. Raff, Elizabeth McIlvaine Associate Curator of the Arts of the Ancient Mediterranean and Byzantium, for stories and insights about the enigmatic ancient Roman sculpture, Portrait Head of a Woman.
